lead_paragraph: Onaje X.O. Woodbine walked away from Yale to Ghana, feeling valued only for his court skills. Now he sees urban basketball as a powerful healing rite.

headline.print_headline: A Philosophical Journey Leads Back to Basketball
headline.main: A Philosophical Journey Leads Back to Basketball

snippet: Onaje X.O. Woodbine walked away from Yale to Ghana, feeling valued only for his court skills. Now he sees urban basketball as a powerful healing rite.
abstract: Profile of Onaje X O Woodbine, former Yale basketball player who now teaches philosophy and religious studies at Phillips Academy; Woodbine, feeling valued only for his basketball skills, walked away from Yale to study in Africa; book Black Gods of the Asphalt: Religion, Hip-Hop, and Street Basketball, written by Woodbine and based on his doctoral dissertation at Boston University, describes how street basketball is outlet for many urban youths.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Black Gods of the Asphalt: Religion, Hip-Hop, and Street Basketball (Book)
